cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with topic modeling in text documents, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) research. The use of paragraph structure is a novel approach that can be applied to various NLP and IR tasks, such as document classification and summarization. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and speech processing. The paper also involves statistical modeling and machine learning techniques, which are common in sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of structured documents and the exploration of semantic properties of paragraphs can also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
